alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 2:42PM PDT until September 01 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 500 PM PDT. * At 242 PM PDT, the public reported flash flooding on Valley of FIre Highway. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Overton, Moapa Town, Moapa Valley, Valley Of Fire, Overton Beach, Echo Bay, Echo Bay Campground and Logandale. This includes the following roads... State Route 167 in Clark County between mile marker 16 and 52. Valley of Fire Highway between mile marker 1 and 10. State Route 168 in Clark County near mile marker 22. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
